bibliographic_metadata.Title: Three-Dimensional Mineral Prospectivity Mapping by XGBoost Modeling: A Case Study of the Lannigou Gold Deposit, China
bibliographic_metadata.Author: Quanping Zhang, Jianping Chen, Hua Xu, Yule Jia, Xuewei Chen, Zhen Jia, Hao Liu

abstract: This study presents a three-dimensional mineral prospectivity mapping (3DMPM) approach using the eXtreme Gradient Boosting (XGBoost) algorithm for the Lannigou gold deposit in Guizhou, China. The model integrates geological data to establish a 3D model and a prospectivity model based on metallogenic systems and geological anomalies. The XGBoost model demonstrated superior performance compared to the weights of evidence method in terms of prediction accuracy.
key_points: 3D geological entity model established using geological data.
XGBoost model outperformed weights of evidence method in prediction accuracy.
Main ore-controlling factors identified through geological anomaly theories.
High prediction accuracy and reduced exploration risk demonstrated by XGBoost.
